title: The Traitor's Son
description: The first in the bestselling Fortune's Wheel trilogy, from Germany's 'Queen of Historical Fiction'. England, 1360: After the death of his father, the Earl of Waringham, twelve-year-old Robin runs away from his monastery school to work as a stable boy. As the son of a presumed traitor he has the status of a peasant, subjugated to the tyrannical whims of the nobility. But Robin flees, and soon, alongside the charismatic Duke of Lancaster, he is fighting military campaigns, quashing revolts, scoring political triumphs - and meeting women.
